SEARCH
Package main

Class Member

java.lang.Object
main.Member
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class Member extends Object implements Runnable
The Member class represents a musical member that plays a BellNote in a synchronized multithreaded environment. Each member runs on its own thread and waits for its turn to play. The class ensures synchronization between multiple members using the giveTurn() method.

      Constructs a new Member object.
      Parameters:

      bn - BellNote the member will play.
      sourceDataLine - The SourceDataLine to write the audio bytes to.

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start()
      Sets running to true and starts the thread.

    • playNote

      public void playNote()
      Plays the members BellNote using the given SourceDataLine.

    • giveTurn

      public void giveTurn()
      Gives the turn to the current member by setting myTurn to true and notifying a waiting thread. If the current member has not completed their previous turn, an IllegalStateException is thrown.

      The method uses synchronization to ensure proper coordination between threads. It waits until the turn is completed before returning.

      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if an attempt is made to give a turn to a member who hasn't completed their current turn.

    • run

      public void run()
      While running, the thread will wait until it is its turn to play its note. Once the thread has played its note, it will notify another thread waiting on the thread.

      The method uses synchronization to ensure proper coordination between threads.

      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Sets running to false and interrupts the thread in case it's waiting.
